title: Have you ever tried using a model with better quality model ` animatediff sdxl` for training?
body:
Hi, thank you for your outstanding work.

I noticed that you are training based on `animatediff v2`. Have you tried using a model with better quality model animatediff sdxl for training? Will replacing with animatediff sdxl improve the generation quality? 

Thank you!
author: wangqiang9

comments.body: No more animate-diff, CogVideoX or Mochi will be your next choice

title: Face Landmarks
body: Hello, thank you for your code, I notice that the face landmarks are not used in your inference demos, however, face landmarks exists in your paper pipeline. I wonder if you use face landmarks in your checkpoint?
author: DuanWei1234

comments.body:
It is not used because turning it on affects the face shape. For example, if you put a fat man as a reference image and infer with a sequence from a slim woman, the man's face will be distorted when turning it on.

However, it will also bring some positive effects.  For example, it will make the expression follow the control.

Thank you for your reply. I have another question, if I use a very small dataset, such as a single video data, to overfit the model and test the effectiveness of the pipeline, will the MSE loss converge within a few steps, such as 1-2K?

> Thank you for your reply. I have another question, if I use a very small dataset, such as a single video data, to overfit the model and test the effectiveness of the pipeline, will the MSE loss converge within a few steps, such as 1-2K?

Have not tried

title: where is common/utils/smplx_color.pt
body: Great work! But I can't find common/utils/smplx_color.pt
author: Tiehr2000

title: FileNotFoundError: file "../../../../_base_/datasets/coco.py" does not exist
body: coco.py not in the prepare_pose\smplerX\main\_base_ directory, causing running error.
author: huiyang865

comments.body: Copy the dataset folder under this path from the original smplerx repository to this repository, and under the dataset folder there is coco.py

title: About SMPL_CS
body: thx your awsome work! when i try to inference my own video, i found that using smplerx rendering mesh leads a bad result, So i want to ask  when do you open the smpl_cs code？ or could you explain that "SMPL-CS integrates 3D, depth, and continuous semantic information" more detailed, so that i can try to make it by myself. thx a lot
author: wkMvg
